alert.note: Alert for Polk; San Jacinto (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 9:34AM CST until January 25 at 8:00AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Long King Creek near Livingston affecting Polk and San Jacinto Counties. For the Long King Creek...including Livingston...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Long King Creek near Livingston. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 21.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM CST Wednesday was 21.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.3 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.4 feet on 10/30/2009. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Long King Creek Livingston 19.0 21.5 Wed 9 am CST 3.6 2.2 2.2 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 345 AM CST.
